Narrator

Upon our arrival to Castle Reinhart, we were greeted by the smiling faces of the Palesian and Lespian delegation as well as Duke Reinhart, who waited at the front gates.

Narrator

Instead, I was here to sign our agreement with Duke Reinhart as resolved by the AN -- giving them all the rights of Aureus. Despite our initial protests, there was nothing I could do about it now.

RiziaDLC.Diplomacy_Pales_Vina_LeadsDeal == true

nan

!(RiziaDLC.Diplomacy_Pales_Vina_LeadsDeal == true)

nan

Narrator

Vina was already inside, standing next to the Palesian foreign affairs team. She came to me when we entered the hall.

Player_Romus

"You must be dying to return home. Thank you for accepting this duty, Vina. It means a lot."

Vina Toras

"They were long and arduous for sure. But honestly, it wasn't as boring as I'd have thought."

Vina Toras

"They were long and arduous for sure. But honestly, it wasn't as boring as I'd have thought."

Vina Toras

"They were long and arduous for sure. But honestly, it wasn't as boring as I'd have thought."

Narrator

Our convoy drove steadily across the cobbled streets of Old Town Pales. It was my third visit to Pales since becoming King of Rizia, but the atmosphere this time was cordial and cheerful as opposed to my earlier visit.

RiziaDLC.Pales_PostIncident_Deal_Cede == true

nan

Narrator

Instead, I was here to sign our deal with Duke Reinhart -- giving us 25% of Aureus. Despite preferring a better deal, there was nothing I could do about it now.

Narrator

Instead, I was here to finalize our deal with Duke Reinhart to acknowledge Palesian ownership completely.

Narrator

After exchanging pleasantries, we were led inside as the light of the cameras blinded us.

Vina Toras

"There were no issues with the agreement, and I'm told everything is ready for you to sign."

Vina Toras

"There were no issues with the agreement, and I'm told everything is ready for you to sign."

Vina Toras

"There were no issues with the agreement, and I'm told everything is ready for you to sign."

Player_Romus

"Great work. Keep it up."

RiziaDLC.Pales_PostIncident_Peace_Deal == true

nan

Axel Reinhart

"Your Majesty. Welcome once again. Despite sad occurrences between our countries, it is delightful to be able to put them behind us and reach an agreement."

Axel Reinhart

"Today is not just about signing a deal, it's about laying the foundation for enduring cooperation and mutual benefit between Pales and Rizia."

Axel Reinhart

"With the signing of our resolution, we will be building a new gas pipeline between our countries. Palesian government and LesPower will be handling the costs as well as the construction."

Narrator

The delegates bowed their heads.

Axel Reinhart

"Rizia has agreed to grant half of the claims they won to Pales -- acknowledging that our state owns 75% of the Aureus field."

RiziaDLC.Pales_PostIncident_Peace_Deal == true

nan

nan

Axel Reinhart

"Rizia has agreed to make the AN's resolution official -- acknowledging that Pales owns the rights to the Aureus field."

Patricio Alvarez (R)

"And Pales agreed to give LesPower shared control over the field."

"In return, Lespia will be granting  extraction rights for one-quarter of the Aureus fields to Rizia."

Narrator

The assistants placed all the necessary papers in front of us to sign.

Player_Romus_Italic

I signed the papers.

Sign the papers.

Narrator

The stage itself was an outlandish construct, with a colossal replica of a pipeline going right through it and a gigantic valve wheel at its center.

Narrator

The geysers were choreographed to erupt in unison with the crescendo of the music.

Laurento Esquibel

"I want to applaud you again, Your Majesty, for your decisive actions that led to a successful deal despite that violent incident."

Laurento Esquibel

"I want to applaud you again, Your Majesty, for your decisive actions that led to a successful deal despite that violent incident."

Laurento Esquibel

"I want to applaud you again, Your Majesty, for your decisive actions that led to a successful deal despite that violent incident."

Laurento Esquibel

"Sorry. I didn't mean to come across as a sycophant."

Laurento Esquibel

"It's already a done deal, Your Majesty. We are here to celebrate."

Laurento Esquibel

"I want to applaud you again, Your Majesty, for your decisive actions that led to a successful resolution."

Laurento Esquibel

"Sorry. I didn't mean to come across as a sycophant."

Laurento Esquibel

"It's already a done deal, Your Majesty. We are here to celebrate."

Player_Romus

"And how was Pales?"

Player_Romus

"Fine."

Player_Romus

"And how did the meetings go?"

Player_Romus

"Well, I missed you too."

Narrator

And we would also be inaugurating the opening of the pipeline -- which will be operational after today.

Narrator

I took the microphone amidst the applause.

Player_Romus

"Duke of Pales, my friend Axel Reinhart. I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for reaching a mutual understanding."

RiziaDLC.Policy_Economy_AureusField_Extractions == true

RiziaDLC.Trait_FunnyKing == true

nan

Player_Romus

"This field will hopefully have many benefits not only for Pales and its people, but also for its neighbors and the region as a whole."

Player_Romus

"Before I finish, I would like to highlight the importance of Lespian-Rizian friendship in Southern Merkopa."

Player_Romus

"Before I finish, I would like to highlight how important it is for the monarchies of Merkopa to stick together."

//

nan

Player_Romus

"As a closing word, I would like to thank everyone who has worked so hard on the design and construction of this gas pipeline: the engineers and builders, and employees of all the contractors involved."

Player_Romus

"I am confident that this project will become an outstanding symbol of the progressive development of the Rizian-Palesian partnership and a pledge of friendship."

RiziaDLC.War_Incident_Border == true || RiziaDLC.War_Incident_Naval == true

nan

Player_Romus

"Thank you and have a good evening."

Player_Romus

"Congratulations everybody!"

Player_Romus

"Godspeed."

Player_Romus

"I am very glad to have addressed you all here, with great fondness and respect. I wish you all the best."

Narrator

The crowd roared in a huge applause. I gave the microphone back to Duke Reinhart.

Narrator

A group of dignitaries, selected for the honor, were guided towards the panel, where they were handed gloves to operate the machinery.

Narrator

Axel Reinhart

"To our future partners! When the pipeline finishes, Palesian gas will help build both Rizian and Lespian industries."
